title: Knee Injury Rehabilitation
patient_profile: A 25-year-old male, amateur soccer player, presenting with right knee pain after a tackle injury.
presenting_complaint: Pain and swelling in the right knee following a direct impact during soccer.
onset: Symptoms started immediately after the injury, 2 days ago.
subjective_evaluation: Patient reports difficulty bearing weight on the affected leg and limited range of motion.

findings: Swelling and tenderness around the medial joint line
Positive Lachman test indicating ACL instability

assessment_data: Likely ACL sprain with possible meniscal involvement. MRI recommended for confirmation.

rehabilitation_phases.acute_phase: Pain management and swelling reduction using ice and compression.
rehabilitation_phases.subacute_phase: Begin gentle range of motion and isometric strengthening exercises.
rehabilitation_phases.return_to_play_phase: Gradual return to running and sport-specific drills after strength recovery.
rehabilitation_phases.immobilization_phase: Knee brace used for 2 weeks post-injury.
rehabilitation_phases.phase_I: Initial 2 weeks focusing on protection and pain control.
rehabilitation_phases.phase_II: Weeks 3-6 focusing on mobility and strengthening.
rehabilitation_phases.strengthening_phase: Progressive resistance exercises for quadriceps and hamstrings.

biomechanics: Altered gait pattern due to pain and reduced knee flexion; emphasis on correcting weight distribution.
